com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.realtime

Class CepConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.realtime.CepConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class CepConnector
extends Object
implements Runnable
    The class that establishes the connection to the notification services. It is based on the SmartCepConnect class that is in the smartrest package. It provides methods to perform operations such as handshake, subscribe/unsubscribe and connect which are required to communicate with the notification services. Hint: This class implements Runnable, but it is designed to manage threading internally. Please do *not* create a thread that starts a connector instance. Created by Ozan Arslan on 18.08.2017

    • Constructor Detail

      • CepConnector

        public CepConnector(CloudOfThingsRestClient cloudOfThingsRestClient,
                    String notificationPath)
        Construct a new CepConnector.
        Parameters:
        cloudOfThingsRestClient - the client to use for connection to the cloud
        notificationPath - a String with REST endpoint path for notification requests (handshake, subscribe, connect...) without host, leading and trailing slashes e.g. cep/realtime

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(String channel)
        The method that is used to subscribe to a given channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - to be subscribed to. Can include * as a wildcard (e.g. "/alarms/*").

        public void unsubscribe(String channel)
        The method used to unsubscribe from a channel that was previously subscribed to.
        Parameters:
        channel - to unsubscribe from

      • connect

        public void connect()
        The method to initiate the connection. It checks the pre-requisite conditions to establish a connection. When the conditions are satisfied it starts the run cycle.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the read timeout for the polling connect request. Default is DEFAULT_READ_TIMEOUT_MILLIS.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds

      • getInterval

        public int getInterval()
        The current interval, which is the time that the polling thread waits before it reconnects, after receiving a response.
        Returns:
        the waiting interval in milliseconds

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int interval)
        Set the time that the polling thread waits before it reconnects, after receiving a response. Default is DEFAULT_RECONNECT_INTERVAL_MILLIS.
        Parameters:
        interval - the waiting interval in milliseconds

      • getClientId

        public String getClientId()
        Get the clientId that was assigned by the server during handshake.
        Returns:
        the clientId or null, if we are not currently connected.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Whether there is currently a polling thread connected to the server.
        Returns:
        true = yes; false = no

      • doConnect

        protected String doConnect()
        The method that does the post request to establish a connection.
        Returns:
        the response of the cloud as a string.

        protected void doHandShake()

        protected void doInitialSubscriptions()
        Post the subscriptions for all channels that were added before we were connected.

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the connector in a separate thread. Not meant to be called directly, please use connect() to start the connector.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
